title: Civic polls: Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena gets 'helping hand' from MNS in Kalyan-Dombivli
content: In a significant post-poll development, the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has extended support to the Shiv Sena in the Kalyan–Dombivli Municipal Corporation. This alliance, with MNS's five corporators backing the Shiv Sena's 53, brings the total to 58, inching closer to the required majority for forming the civic body's government.

title: Trump vs Khamenei: US president's 'wipe them off' warning to Tehran's 'will cut that hand' threat
content: United States President Donald Trump on Tuesday said America would wipe out Iran if the Islamic nation assassinates him. Trump's remark came hours after Iran warned him not to take any action against the country's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.  Trump had previously said he's given his advisors instructions to obliterate Iran if the country is behind an assassination of him.

title: 'Count now 70': Congress takes jibe at PM Modi over 'good friend' Trump's Ind-Pak remarks
content: The Congress party has sharply criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi following US President Donald Trump's repeated claims of single-handedly resolving the India-Pakistan conflict last year. Trump asserted he prevented a nuclear escalation, saving millions of lives, a claim India has consistently refuted, stating no third-party mediation was involved.

title: Musk vs Altman: CEOs fight over ChatGPT, Tesla deaths; OpenAI defends user safeguards
content: Elon Musk publicly criticized OpenAI's ChatGPT, citing alleged links to multiple deaths. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman retorted, accusing Musk of hypocrisy and highlighting Tesla's Autopilot-related fatalities. Altman defended ChatGPT's safety measures, acknowledging the difficulty in balancing user protection with tool accessibility.

title: US free Europe? EU chief Leyen invokes 1971 ‘Nixon shock’ in Davos; what it means
content: At the World Economic Forum, European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen referenced the 1971 "Nixon shock" to urge Europe to leverage current geopolitical disruptions as a catalyst for change. She highlighted the event's lesson on reducing dependency on foreign currencies, advocating for a new form of European strategic autonomy.

title: ‘Your career’s ruined’: Judge warns TISS students linked to Saibaba event
content: In a striking pronouncement, a Mumbai court sounded the alarm for nine TISS students applying for anticipatory bail, warning that their alleged connection to a criminal case could jeopardize their professional paths. The students are being probed for initiating an unauthorized gathering in honor of a professor currently imprisoned over suspected Maoist affiliations.

title: 'Will hunt you down': TMC's Manirul Islam threatens EC to 'teach a lesson' over SIR
content: Manirul Islam, threatening the Election Commission, is not his first brush with controversy, as the Farakka MLA was accused of leading a mob to the Block Development Office (BDO) in his constituency and ransacking the space, leaving officials injured. After the incident, BJP MLA Gouri Sankar attacked Mamata Banerjee for instigating her party cadres across the state to commit riots and violence.

title: Anupam Mittal’s AI warning: Tech entrepreneur predicts middle manager's risk; urges upskilling in India
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal warns that AI agents are poised to replace middle managers, diminishing the value of traditional "knowledge premium."  Companies are already investing in AI-driven operations, making roles like "VP of Operations" endangered.  This trend mirrors recent moves by tech giants like Google and Amazon to flatten hierarchies and empower individual contributors.

title: Prayagraj: IAF trainer aircraft crashes in pond; both pilots rescued
content: On Wednesday, a microlight trainer aircraft from the Indian Air Force made an unexpected plunge into a pond in Prayagraj. Thankfully, the brave pilots were safely extracted from the water after the incident. This mishap is the second of its kind this month, following a regional flight's emergency landing near Rourkela on January 10, where everyone on board emerged unscathed.

title: Hindu leader Harshita Thakur, 6 others booked for provocative gesture towards dargah
content: Hindu leader Harshita Thakur faces a complaint for allegedly hurting religious sentiments and promoting disharmony during a procession in Belagavi. She is accused of making a provocative gesture towards a dargah, accompanied by religious slogans. Police have registered a case against Thakur and six others.

title: 'ChatGPT is dying': Legendary investor says $500bn company faces collapse— read his 600-word note
content: Veteran investor George Noble warns OpenAI is "falling apart" despite its $500 billion valuation. He cites internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, massive quarterly losses of $12 billion, and unsustainable costs for tools like Sora. Key departures and Elon Musk's lawsuit further highlight significant internal turmoil and financial strain.

title: Shubman Gill wants Test regulars to play Ranji Trophy; firms up ODI WC plans - exclusive
content: Shubman Gill wants India’s Test regulars to feature in the Ranji Trophy to ensure red-ball readiness ahead of the Sri Lanka tour, which is scheduled in August later this year. At the same time, the management is firming up 2027 ODI World Cup plans, with a focus on middle-overs penetration and building a fast-bowling core.

title: 'Make in India' boost: Customs duty on some electronics increased to 20%
content: India has boosted domestic electronics manufacturing by revising customs duties. The government increased the duty on flat panel displays to 20% while lowering it on key components to 5%. This move aims to strengthen local production, mirroring the success seen in the smartphone sector, and foster a self-reliant display manufacturing ecosystem.

title: Woman found dead in LIC building fire was murdered by colleague; how the case unravelled
content: A planned murder disguised as a fire accident has been uncovered at a Madurai LIC office. Senior branch manager A Kalyani Nambi was allegedly murdered by her colleague, D Ram, who set her ablaze to destroy incriminating death claim files. Ram confessed after inconsistencies in his initial statement and the discovery of petrol bottles in his cabin.

title: WPL: RCB players take morning walk on Indian road; video goes viral
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru players Lauren Bell, Nadine de Klerk, and Georgia Voll were spotted enjoying a morning walk in Vadodara ahead of WPL 2026 matches, delighting fans. The outing highlighted player safety concerns after last year’s Australian women cricketers’ harassment in Indore. BCCI condemned the incident, praising prompt police action, while ensuring stricter security protocols for visiting players.

title: ‘We want to play’: Star B'desh batter voices players' plea; T20 WC standoff deepens
content: Bangladesh cricketers express a strong desire to participate in the upcoming T20 World Cup. Star batter Najmul Hossain Shanto highlighted the players' eagerness to compete on the global stage. This comes as the Bangladesh Cricket Board maintains its stance against playing matches in India. The International Cricket Council Board is set to make a final decision on the matter soon.

title: MasterChef India contestant Manisha Sharma refused to let Parkinson’s decide her limits
content: Manisha Sharma, a MasterChef India contestant, found her calling in cooking after a childhood act of love and later, as a way to cope with Parkinson's. Her journey from home kitchens to the show highlights her resilience, unique fusion style, and unwavering confidence, proving that passion can be found in unexpected places.

title: Young girls could face a health crisis tomorrow: Doctor shares what needs to change now
content: Young girls face significant health risks like obesity and mental health issues due to modern lifestyles. Experts highlight poor nutrition, excessive screen time, and lack of physical activity as major contributors. Early monitoring and lifestyle changes, including balanced diets and outdoor play, are crucial for preventing long-term health problems and ensuring a healthier future for adolescent girls.

title: Gold price skyrockets! Yellow metal crosses Rs 1.53 lakh — Should you buy or sell?
content: Gold prices hit a record high on Wednesday, with silver trading near its all-time peak. Investors flocked to these safe-haven assets amidst escalating geopolitical tensions and trade uncertainties.  The surge was fueled by a US Supreme Court decision and tariff threats, driving domestic and international markets higher. Experts advise a cautious 'buy-on-dips' approach.

title: ‘Air power did the trick’: IAF chief says attacked Pakistan within hours
content: Air Chief Marshal AP Singh highlighted air power's crucial role in modern warfare, citing its ability to achieve swift, decisive outcomes. He emphasized its effectiveness in missions ranging from evacuations to striking multiple targets in Pakistan within hours.

title: Refuse to be bullied at work? These simple boundaries experts swear by actually help
content: Workplace bullying often begins subtly, eroding confidence and well-being. Experts emphasize setting clear, consistent boundaries as a crucial self-care strategy. These quiet assertions, like neutral language and documenting incidents, protect mental health and dignity, shifting focus from confrontation to self-preservation.

title: Teacher shares her incredible fight against endometrial adenocarcinoma
content: Meeta Khanna's journey through Endometrial Adenocarcinoma, diagnosed in 2021, highlights the profound strength of cancer survivors. After a rigorous treatment including surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation until late 2022, Meeta is now cancer-free. She emphasizes the importance of unwavering support and is actively reclaiming her life, inspiring others with her resilience and determination to thrive.

title: Saina exclusive: ‘Those goosebumps will never fade’ — Olympic glory & emotional goodbye
content: Emotional Saina Nehwal announced her retirement from badminton, citing a chronic knee condition that prevents her from competing at the highest level. The 2012 London Olympics bronze medalist, India's first in badminton, expressed gratitude for the love and support received throughout her illustrious career. She remains optimistic about India's future Olympic gold medal prospects in various sports.

title: ‘I made a big mistake’: UP govt clerk kills wife, mother and 2 sons, then shoots self
content: A government clerk allegedly murdered his wife, mother, and two sons before taking his own life in Saharanpur. Police are investigating the murder-suicide after finding the family dead in a locked room with gunshot wounds. A social media message from the clerk, citing a "big mistake," is central to the probe.

title: Viral stunt in Noida: Man’s year-old stunt clip with kid on sports car roof leads to arrest
content: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Greater Noida West for performing a dangerous stunt with a child on the roof of a sports car. The video, likely a year old, resurfaced on social media, prompting police action. The man was apprehended and warned against future reckless behavior.

title: Missed meeting Shukla on ISS, he reached just after I left: Sunita Williams
content: Indian-American astronaut Sunita Williams, a record-holder for spacewalking, shared her experiences at the American Center in Delhi. She spoke about her recent extended stay on the ISS, the challenges faced, and the growing commercialization of space. Williams also highlighted the importance of international cooperation in space exploration and inspired Indian students to pursue careers in the sector.

title: 'It's in the first!' Vaishnaw on IMF chief calling India 'second-tier AI power'
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has refuted the IMF's "second-tier AI power" classification, citing Stanford's rankings and India's focus on widespread AI diffusion. He asserted India's strength across all five AI architecture layers, emphasizing the application layer as a key opportunity for global service provision and economic returns.

title: ‘He’s a T-rex’: Global leaders react to Trump’s Greenland threats - watch
content: Global leaders at the World Economic Forum expressed alarm over President Trump's Greenland ambitions and trade policies, warning of a return to colonial-era power politics. French president Macron decried a "new colonial approach" and a "world without rules," while California Governor Newsom urged allies to show more spine.

title: Husband cannot evade maintenance obligation solely for disobeying restitution decree: Supreme Court
content: The central question before the Supreme Court was whether a wife’s failure to cohabit with her husband and comply with a decree for restitution of conjugal rights, without sufficient reason, by itself attracts the disqualification under Section 125(4) CrPC, denying her maintenance.

title: Stock market today: Here are the top 10 gainers and losers on NSE, BSE - Check list
content: Indian stock markets traded mostly lower on Wednesday, with benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty experiencing significant early declines due to geopolitical tensions and foreign fund outflows. While both indices pared some losses by midday, they remained in the red. Global markets also showed weakness, with Asian equities mostly down and US markets closing sharply lower overnight.

title: Dhinakaran rejoins NDA: AMMK chief meets Piyush Goyal; hopes to bring back 'Amma's rule'
content: T T V Dhinakaran's AMMK has formally rejoined the NDA. He accepts Edappadi K Palaniswami as the coalition's chief ministerial candidate. This move has caused concern among AMMK supporters. Dhinakaran will attend Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rally. Seat-sharing talks are underway for the alliance.

title: Sharp U-turn: Trump switches plane after electrical issue; resumes Davos trip for WEF
content: Air Force One, carrying President Trump, made an unexpected return to Joint Base Andrews due to a minor electrical issue mid-flight. The President and his team will board a different aircraft to continue their journey to Davos for the World Economic Forum. The White House confirmed the decision was made out of an abundance of caution.

title: ETPL: Bachchan’s brainchild draws Waugh, Maxwell, Dwyer - Inside Europe’s new T20 league
content: With cricket set to return to the Olympics, the European T20 Premier League, backed by the cricket's governing body ICC, aims to transform associate cricket by bringing elite global stars to Europe. Backed by Bollywood actor Abhishek Bachchan and featuring names like Steve Waugh, Mitchell Santner and Glenn Maxwell, ETPL offers exposure, credibility and development opportunities across Scotland, Ireland and the Netherlands.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are gold, silver prices headed & will rally continue?
content: Gold price prediction today: Maneesh Sharma of Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers is of the view that while gold prices may continue to rise in the near term, silver prices are expected to see some volatility.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' makers cite legal threat from streamer
content: During a recent court hearing, producers indicated that Amazon Prime Video is contemplating legal measures due to the indefinite release scenario of Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan.' The film's rollout has been impacted by the CBFC's insistence on cuts and a breakdown in communication channels.

title: Pune: Woman drives man for 2km on bonnet at 60 kmph; video goes viral
content: A woman in Pune drove a cab driver on her car's bonnet for 2km at 50-60km/hour after hitting a bike. The cabby sustained a fractured hand. Police arrested the woman after video clips of the incident circulated on social media.

title: 13,479 ft of stupidity: Haryana man pastes 'Gurjar' sticker on BRO milestone in Ladakh
content: A tourist from Haryana has ignited public fury after defacing a Border Roads Organisation milestone at Ladakh's Fotu La Pass by pasting a caste sticker. The act, captured on video, has been widely condemned as vandalism and irresponsible behaviour in a sensitive border region, prompting calls for strict action against the individual.

title: T20 WC: Pakistan backs Bangladesh in venue standoff; writes to ICC ahead of crucial meet
content: Pakistan Cricket Board has formally backed Bangladesh's decision to avoid playing matches in India for the 2026 T20 World Cup. This move comes as the International Cricket Council prepares to meet and decide on Bangladesh's participation. Bangladesh cited political and security concerns for their stance. The ICC has so far maintained that the tournament schedule will not change.

title: Watch: Danish MP abuses Trump in EU speech; uses 'F' bomb that 'Mr President might understand'
content: A Danish lawmaker in the European Parliament used strong language to condemn US President Donald Trump's interest in Greenland. The President has repeatedly expressed a desire to bring the Arctic territory under American control. This move has sparked concerns about Greenland's sovereignty among European representatives. The lawmaker's outburst reflects growing frustration over Trump's public pressure on the issue.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 slips below 25,000; BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points
content: Indian equity benchmarks Nifty50 and BSE Sensex opened lower on Wednesday, mirroring global weakness driven by escalating US-Europe trade tensions and Trump's policies. Analysts anticipate a short-term technical rebound due to oversold conditions, advising caution and a wait-and-watch approach for stability.

title: India’s leading vaulters fined by the railways for carrying ‘poles’; stranded for hours
content: National record holder Dev Meena and his teammates were delayed for hours at Panvel station, missing their train to Bhopal. Railway officials demanded a penalty for their pole vault equipment, deeming them 'steel pipes'. Despite explaining their athlete status, the team paid a fine and incurred extra travel costs, causing significant inconvenience.

title: Baseball Hall of Fame voting winners, losers and who could get in next
content: The results are in! Our experts break down the highs and lows of the 2026 vote and look ahead to 2027.

title: Sources: McDaniel set to become Chargers OC
content: Former Miami Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel is expected to become the Los Angeles Chargers' offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets continue overhaul, land OF Robert in trade
content: Luis Robert Jr., a former Gold Glover who hit 38 home runs two seasons ago, is headed to the Mets in a trade that sends infielder Luisangel Acuna and right-hander Truman Pauley to the White Sox.

title: Beltran, A. Jones elected to Baseball Hall of Fame
content: Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones, center fielders who excelled at the plate and with their gloves, were voted into the Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: Mayfield takes swipe at ex-coach Stefanski in post
content: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield jabbed at new Falcons coach Kevin Stefanski, saying, "Can't wait to see you twice a year, Coach."

title: Harbaugh: Too much focus on Giants' hierarchy
content: New Giants coach John Harbaugh said too much is being made of who has more power to make decisions and that it's important that he and GM Joe Schoen work together.

title: Dubs don't envision Butler trade despite ACL tear
content: Warriors GM Mike Dunleavy told reporters he has no plans to move Jimmy Butler's contract at the trade deadline, despite the veteran forward suffering a season-ending ACL tear.

title: UCLA's Cronin blasts Big Ten over scheduling
content: UCLA's upset of No. 4 Purdue seemed to do little to ease Mick Cronin's wrath over the Big Ten's scheduling, with the Bruins coach saying, "I don't think they care about basketball."

title: Former Bama standout sues NCAA over eligibility
content: Charles Bediako, who entered the 2023 NBA draft and played in the G League, has sued the NCAA to gain reinstatement to join the Crimson Tide.

title: 8-8 in the playoffs with Josh Allen? Buffalo fired Sean McDermott, but there's more blame to go around
content: With postseason losses piling up, the Bills fired McDermott. But will it change anything? And where did things go wrong?

title: Men's Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Women's Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: NBA midseason debate: Are the Thunder in trouble? Can the Clippers really climb in the West?
content: ESPN analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton break down the league's biggest storylines from leading challengers to surprise contenders.

title: NBA All-Star rosters: Starters, snubs and biggest questions
content: Who was the biggest surprise or snub? Which superstar duo are we most excited to see? Experts break it down.

title: 'Obviously, we would have a great team': What Russian NHLers are saying about missing the Olympics
content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many who'd otherwise be playing.

title: NFL execs predict 2026 moves: Lamar Jackson, A.J. Brown trades coming?
content: We asked NFL executives to make bold predictions about this offseason and next season. Could we see two superstar trades?

title: Let's overreact to divisional round games: Pause Stroud's extension talks?
content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of the games.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Sizing up the top contenders for next season
content: Who will raise the national championship trophy this time next year? We break down the teams to watch.

title: CFP takeaways: Even as a favored Goliath, Indiana's win stands alone in sports history
content: Put it next to the Miracle on Ice or NC State and Villanova. In a wild title game, here's how Indiana beat Miami.

title: Wetzel: Hoosiers delivered a national title for the everyman
content: Curt Cignetti's relentless group of discards and misfits showed what the transfer portal made possible.

title: Vinícius Júnior roars back into form, much to the Bernabéu's delight
content: It's been a rollercoaster of a week for Real Madrid, but a convincing win over Monaco in the Champions League has allowed them to go back on track.

title: Between Gabriel Jesus and Gyökeres, Arsenal's striker battle is heating up
content: Gabriel Jesus and Viktor Gyökeres each staked their claims to Arsenal's No. 9 spot in their win over Inter Milan.

title: USMNT World Cup big board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: The Caleb throw, a controversial call and plenty of mistakes: Barnwell sizes up 11 divisional round plays
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: Could this be Novak Djokovic's best shot at a record 25th major title?
content: Djokovic has lost just six matches at the Australian Open in 19 years. If he's going to break the majors record, this would be the time.

title: Does bringing in a 'caretaker manager' work? Will Man United and Real Madrid improve?
content: Both Man United and Real Madrid abruptly fired their coaches without permanent replacements lined up, so "caretaker managers" will see out the season.

title: The Knicks, Nets and a crosstown friendship nearly two decades in the making
content: In 2009, Mike Brown met Jordi Fernandez and got him an internship with the Cavaliers. Seventeen years later, their relationship runs far deeper just than New York City basketball rivals.

title: 'Are you happy?': Cignetti's daughter revisits viral 2019 post after father's national title win
content: In 2019, Natalie asked her father if he was happy. He wasn't. Now, his answer to the same question is different.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United explore Loftus-Cheek loan
content: Manchester United are exploring their options over a move for AC Milan's Ruben Loftus-Cheek. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail 2026 UFC championship predictions.

title: Davos LIVE Updates: Canada, France Flag 'Rupture' In US-Led Order Before Trump's Address
content: Davos LIVE Updates: US President Donald Trump's third visit to Davos as president comes as US allies worry about his ambition to take over Greenland.

title: Woman Arrested for Husband's Murder After Autopsy Reveals He Was Strangled
content: What initially appeared to be a mysterious and accidental death in Hyderabad has now been confirmed as a case of murder. The Cyberabad Police have arrested a woman for allegedly killing her husband and attempting to conceal the crime

title: "If Not At Table, We're On Menu": Canada PM's Warning To "Middle Powers"
content: Mark Carney, Canada's Prime Minister, used his address at the 2026 World Economic Forum in Davos to deliver a watershed moment in global diplomacy.

title: UAE To Partner With Telangana To Develop India's First Net-Zero Smart City
content: UAE Minister of Economy and Tourism, HE Abdulla bin Touq Al Marri, met the Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy-led Telangana Rising delegation at the World Economic Forum in the Swiss city.

title: Woman Stabs One-Year-Old Daughter After Dispute With Husband In Maharashtra
content: A woman allegedly killed her one-year-old daughter following a dispute with her husband, a labourer, over returning home late in Maharashtra's Latur district, police said.

title: Adani Group Unveils $66 Billion Investment Plan For Maharashtra At Davos
content: The Adani Group on Wednesday outlined a USD 66 billion investment blueprint for Maharashtra, spanning aviation, clean energy, urban infrastructure, digital platforms and advanced manufacturing

title: After Elephant Attack Kills 22, Jharkhand Declares 'Emergency'
content: Jharkhand government has declared an "elephant emergency" after a wild elephant went on a deadly rampage in West Singhbhum district. Forest officials said the animal became extremely aggressive after being separated from its herd and killed 22 people

title: New BJP Chief Nitin Nabin Hits Ground Running, First Meeting Focuses On Poll Strategy
content: Nitin Nabin, BJP's newly appointed national president, has begun his tenure with a sharp focus on organisation and elections, and by chairing his first major meeting at the BJP headquarters in Delhi.

title: UK Approves China's Plan For Its Largest Embassy In Europe In London
content: Britain's government gave approval on Tuesday for China to build its largest embassy in Europe in London, hoping to improve ties with Beijing despite British and US politicians' warnings that it could be used as a base for spying.

title: Video: Small Aircraft Crashes Into Pond In UP's Prayagraj
content: A small aircraft crashed into a pond in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj today. The aircraft, reportedly an Army training plane, went down in a pond located behind KP College in the city, triggering panic in the area.

title: Raids At Telangana Deputy Collector's Home In Disproportionate Assets Case
content: Venkat Reddy was arrested by ACB officials after he was caught accepting a bribe of Rs 60,000 while handling a school contract renewal case in December last year.

title: Pakistan's Khawaja Asif Inaugurates Fake 'Pizza Hut'. Real One Responds
content: Floral arrangements were in place, the red carpet was rolled out, and cameras were rolling when Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif walked in confidently to cut the ribbon of a "Pizza Hut" outlet in Sialkot's cantonment area recently.

title: Water Bankruptcy Era Has Begun For Billions, Scientists Say
content: A new era has begun of "global water bankruptcy", with humans depleting freshwater systems to the point they can't recover, according to a new United Nations report.

title: Team Shinde Alleges "International Conspiracy" In Maharashtra Civic Body Polls
content: Sanjay Nirupam, a senior leader of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena, has called for a high-level investigation into an alleged "international conspiracy" following the Maharashtra municipal corporation poll results.

title: Trump Marks 1st Anniversary With 365 Achievements, Complains About No Credit
content: US President Donald Trump marked the first anniversary of his return to the White House on Tuesday with a rambling, often downbeat news conference that leaned heavily on familiar grievances rather than celebration.

title: Mining To Army Base Built Into Ice, US Military's Long History In Greenland
content: In spring 1941, Denmarks ambassador signed a treaty giving the US military access to Greenland to help protect the island from Nazi Germany and contribute to the war effort in Europe. That agreement, updated in 1951 and 2004, continues today.

title: Ex-South Korea PM Han Duck-Soo Gets 23-Year Jail Term In Martial Law Case
content: A South Korean court on Wednesday sentenced former Prime Minister Han Duck-soo to 23 years in jail for charges including engaging in a key action of insurrection concerning ex-President Yoon Suk Yeol's declaration of martial law in December 2024.

title: Fact Check: Trump's Repeated "Settled 8 Wars" Claims On One-Year In Office
content: The conflicts Trump counts among those that he has solved are between Israel and Hamas, Israel and Iran, Egypt and Ethiopia, India and Pakistan, Serbia and Kosovo, Rwanda and Congo, Armenia and Azerbaijan, and Cambodia and Thailand.

title: "Especially For Elon": Ryanair Roasts Musk With "Great Idiots" Sale
content: The clash began last week when Ryanair CEO Michael O'Leary rejected Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet service for his planes.

title: "India In First Group Of AI Powers": Ashwini Vaishnaw Counters IMF Ranking At Davos
content: Minister for Electronics and Information Technology Ashwini Vaishnaw pushed back strongly against remarks by International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva that placed India in a "second grouping" of AI powers

title: Buried oceans of magma may be protecting alien planets from destruction
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More

title: Kerala CM reads parts of govt’s policy speech omitted by guv
content: the governor omitted sections critical of the central govt, prompting the CM to express his strong opposition . the speaker responded to the governor's actions, stating that the entire speech should be considered as read . if the governor deliberately omits or adds to it, it is wrong .

title: Blue Monday: Why Marc Guéhi joining Man City leaves Liverpool in a mess
content: the third Monday of January has been widely dubbed "Blue Monday" for more than two decades . skeptics would argue the occasion is nothing more than a marketing ploy . liverpool fans will certainly have felt glum on Monday afternoon after marc Guéhi's transfer .

title: MLB offseason grades: Rating Mets' latest pickup in trade for Luis Robert Jr.
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . Bradford Doolittle and David Schoenfield will evaluate each move as it happens, so check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: How Jannik Sinner has changed his game since the US Open
content: Jannik Sinner won two of the four majors in 2025 and was within one point of a third . he has won seven of their past nine meetings . but he says he was very predictable today . Sinner is tipped to become a better player .

title: 💯 Arizona high schooler breaks scoring record
content: Adrian Stubbs needed just three quarters to drop 100 points in 109-25 victory at Yuma Kofa . the 5-foot-10 guard broke the previous record of 75 points held by George McCormick since 1966 . he's not on a short list for can't-miss NIL targets for major companies .

title: Indiana -- yes, Indiana! -- is the national champ! How Curt Cignetti and the Hoosiers did it
content: a year ago, it felt hard to believe the losingest program in FBS history would have much staying power . critics ripped their schedule, called them a fluke, debated whether they even deserved to make the college football Playoff . they should leave the real football to the real blue bloods . the man simply does not lose .

title: 'General soreness': Warriors' Butler brings back viral meme after tearing right ACL
content: he posted an edited photo of him dressed in military-style attire with a message written above it: "general soreness" the meme went viral during the 2018-19 season, which coincided with Butler requesting a trade from the Minnesota Timberwolves in September 2018 .

title: Which injuries will have the biggest impact on the Olympic hockey tournament?
content: leo Carlsson is out three to five weeks with a thigh injury . the 21-year-old has 38 points through 29 games this season . he has been struggling recently to the tune of six points in 15 games .

title: H.D. Kumaraswamy favours JD(S) alliance with BJP in local body polls in Karnataka

title: Noida techie death: what we know so far
content: The uncovered pit, fed by rainwater and drains and lying just off a well-developed road with no barricades and an almost 90-degree turn, had become a serious hazard long before the crash that claimed Yuvraj Mehta’s life.

title: Sabarimala gold loss case: Kerala court grants bail to prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti

title: Don’t engage in mudslinging against judges: Madras High Court Chief Justice to ‘Savukku’ Shankar’s counsel

content: “A few weeks ago, the Union Home Ministry instructed the CRPF to take charge of his security following his announcement as the new BJP party leader,” officials said

title: Talaq-e-Hasan explained as SC hears validity challenge; how it differs from triple talaq
content: Through Talaq-e-Hasan, a man can dissolve a marriage by pronouncing the word “talaq” once every month over a three-month period.

content: The Election Commission of India’s Special Intensive Revision process has triggered complaints as genuine voters face verification notices and possible removal from the electoral rolls across 12 states.

title: India’s traffic chokehold: Bengaluru ranks second; Pune fifth in global congestion index for 2025
content: Of the top 10 cities with the highest congestion in Asia, six are from India: Bengaluru, Pune, Mumbai, New Delhi, Kolkata, Jaipur. Chennai ranked 11th, while Hyderabad is placed 15th

content: L’Oreal to set up the facility in November. The world renowned cosmetics company was invited to explore  manufacturing unit in Hyderabad.

title: Charter of rights for People Living with HIV and ART to be placed before State HIV conclave

title: The darker side of Madras in the 1860s
content: Prison life today is often spoken of in hushed terms, where those inside manage to get what they want, from narcotics to deadly weapons. It is interesting that it was no different in the 1860s.

title: On the approach, outlook of Tamil Nadu’s Scheduled Caste leaders in late 1940s
content: In the 1946 elections to various provinces, the Congress demonstrated its superiority over the Scheduled Castes Federation (SCF) founded by B.R. Ambedkar. In the erstwhile Madras Presidency, the party bagged 27 out of 30 seats allotted to SCs.

title: Chennai’s iconic annual fair at Island Grounds turns 50
content: The 70-day-long India Tourism and Industrial Fair that began at the Island Grounds in the city recently turned 50 this year. The Sutrula Porutkatchi was conceived and named by former Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi. It began in the city in 1974 as the ‘Pongal Tourist Trade Fair.’
